author: pipermerriam
content: Is there anyone who would be interested in authoring an EIP to add an accumulator to the block header for the Eth1 chain.  The accumulator would be modeled loosely after the beacon chain accumulator for historical block headers.  (https://ethresear.ch/t/double-batched-merkle-log-accumulator/571).  Probably a new field in the block header.  Probably something that would contain at least (block_hash, total_difficulty).  This is valuable work towards making eth1 more friendly to light clients.  Worth noting that the total_difficulty inclusion is a little awkward at this stage with the merge being close around the corner, but we can work out that detail along the way.

author: axic3354
content: I think these two are relevant pieces (https://ethresear.ch/t/state-of-block-header-sync-in-light-clients/8047 and https://ethresear.ch/t/the-curious-case-of-blockhash-and-stateless-ethereum/7304), but they were put on pause due to https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2935, lately The Merge, and of course lack of time.

author: axic3354
content: And these two were somewhat related EIPs: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2622 and https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2628

author: .vbuterin
content: What's the point of doing this now? Especially given that the beacon chain already includes a block hash and state root accumulator

author: .vbuterin
content: Why not just add history introspection opcodes into the post-merge cleanup hard fork?

author: pipermerriam
content: I believe you are right. Hadn't fully re-evaluated the need in the context of the merge

author: pipermerriam
content: Not sure it is adequate justification but getting this in pre merge would let us dig into pre-merge history much more easily.

author: .vbuterin
content: It would still only help us with a few months of pre-merge history

author: pipermerriam
content: I would advocate for the eip to backfill the accumulator back to genesis

author: .vbuterin
content: Realistically I think at merge time we can just run a script to generate some Merkle roots of history and receipt data, and applications can add special-case code to use that as a root

author: .vbuterin
content: Someone can just write a "history proof verifier" wrapper contract that accepts and checks proofs of the correct type
